alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 4:10PM EST until February 20 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding threatens low lying roads and structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EST Friday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.4 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall early Sunday morning, before rising slightly to 23.7 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.4 feet on 03/18/1963. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued by midnight tonight.
